refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: mosquitto provides SSL support for encrypted network connections and authentication. This manual describes how to create the files needed.

note.para: It is important to use different certificate subject parameters for your CA, server and clients. If the certificates appear identical, even though generated separately, the broker/client will not be able to distinguish between them and you will experience difficult to diagnose errors.

refsect1.title: Certificate Authority
refsect1.para: Generate a certificate authority certificate and key.

refsect1.title: Server
refsect1.para: Generate a server key without encryption.
Generate a certificate signing request to send to the CA.
Send the CSR to the CA, or sign it with your CA key:

listitem.para: openssl x509 -req -in server.csr -CA ca.crt -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial -out server.crt -days <duration>

refsect1.title: Client
refsect1.para: Generate a certificate signing request to send to the CA.
Send the CSR to the CA, or sign it with your CA key:

listitem.para: openssl x509 -req -in client.csr -CA ca.crt -CAkey ca.key -CAcreateserial -out client.crt -days <duration>
